newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Second minor incident in a day at Mobil Singapore.
newsitem.headline: Second minor incident in a day at Mobil Singapore.

text.p: Mobil Oil Singapore's said a minor incident occured at its 280,000 barrel-per-day refinery later Tuesday, following a fire that occured in the morning.
Mobil said in a statement at 1505 hours, there was some smouldering on the seal of one of its tank caused possibly by lightning.
"The smouldering was put out by the in-built foam installation in the tank by 1525 hours," it said.
Mobil said in the statement that there were no casualties, work stoppages on turnaround activities or product losses as a result of the incident.
The tank contained light virgin naphtha.
Mobil's 280,000 barrels-per-day refinery was shut on March 15 for maintenance and debottlenecking to raise its capacity to 300,000 bpd.
Early this morning, firefighters took 27 minutes to extinguish a fire which involved a large quantity of oil in the production area at Jurong refinery.
On Monday, Mobil suspended maintenance work at its aromatics plant following a gas leak which resulted in one fatality and six others injured.
The refinery also had a flash fire on March 25, which was extinguished in a few minutes.
